mismatches.description: ITC claimed in GSTR-3B exceeds available credit in GSTR-2B by ₹8.92L
mismatches.narrative: Reliance Trading Corp claimed IGST ITC of ₹18,42,350 in November 2024 GSTR-3B, but the auto-populated GSTR-2B shows eligible ITC of only ₹9,50,000. The excess of ₹8,92,350 has no supporting documentation in the GSTR-2B. Analysis shows the buyer manually entered additional ITC of ₹8,92,350 under 'All other ITC' section of GSTR-3B Table 4(A)(5), which is meant only for ITC on imports, ISD credits, and transitional credits — none of which apply here. The buyer has a history of claiming excess ITC in 3 of the previous 5 months.

Repeat offender: 3 of last 5 months show excess claims (Jul, Sep, Oct 2024)
mismatches.resolution_actions:

mismatches.description: Invoice date in GSTR-1 (May) differs from GSTR-2B period (June) — period mismatch
mismatches.narrative: Invoice INV/2425/000089 from Bharat Electronics Ltd is dated 28-May-2024 and reported in May 2024 GSTR-1, but appears in the buyer's June 2024 GSTR-2B. This period mismatch occurred because the supplier filed May GSTR-1 on 12-Jun-2024 (1 day after the normal deadline), causing the invoice to spill into the June GSTR-2B cycle. While not necessarily fraudulent, the ITC of ₹1,78,900 should be claimed in June 2024 GSTR-3B (when it appears in GSTR-2B) rather than May 2024. If already claimed in May, it should be reversed and re-claimed in June.
mismatches.evidence_path:

No monetary loss — only timing difference in ITC claim
mismatches.resolution_actions:

If already claimed in May, reverse in June; no interest if corrected promptly
